name: The Block
title: Utf8b8jutw Crypto Goes Riskoff Amid Deepseek
text:
Synopsis
Crypto markets experienced a significant risk-off sentiment driven by macroeconomic uncertainty and the release of the Chinese AI app DeepSeek, with Bitcoin dropping below $100,000 and AI-related crypto tokens experiencing substantial declines.

Key Insights
- Bitcoin dropped over 5% in 24 hours, falling below $100,000 for the first time since Jan. 16
- AI-related crypto tokens (NEAR, ICP, RENDER, FET) saw drops between 8-11%
- Nvidia experienced a 15% decline, its largest drop since 2020
- Some analysts forecast a potential Bitcoin pullback to $70,000
- Standard Chartered analyst Geoffrey Kendrick views the dip as a buying opportunity
- Ripple secured Money Transmitter Licenses in New York and Texas, expanding its US footprint
- Trump's pro-crypto executive orders drove $1.9 billion in net inflows to crypto investment products
- MicroStrategy acquired an additional 10,107 BTC for $1.1 billion, bringing total holdings to 471,107 BTC
- Erik Voorhees' AI platform Venice launched its VVV token on Ethereum Layer 2 Base
- Upcoming FOMC meeting and potential interest rate changes are contributing to market uncertainty
